main.name: Ramanpreet
main.description: Software Engineer with Frontend Development, Backend Development experience across diverse industries including banking, healthcare, and research
main.bio: Hi there! I am Ramanpreet Kaur -- Software Engineer with experience in Software Development, Backend development, Cloud Infrastructure, Software Testing contributing to projects across diverse industries including banking, healthcare, and research. Committed to driving collaborative innovation in building robust, scalable, and user-centric solutions to address complex real-world challenges.

education.degree: Master of Science: Information Systems and Technology

education.school: University Institute of Engineering and Technology
education.degree: Bachelor of Engineering: Eectronics and Communication

projects.title: Healthcare Data Platform
projects.description: Worked on a large-scale healthcare data project for Healthfirst to build a unified and analytics-ready data platform. Ingested and processed raw data from multiple sources including MHS, 834, MP, and HRP. Created an Operational Data Store (ODS) as a refined layer to standardize the data, and developed Lakehouse architecture on top of it for analytical consumption. Authored STTM (Source to Target Mapping) and metamodel documentation to ensure accurate data lineage, governance, and business understanding across stakeholders.
features: Ingested raw data from heterogeneous healthcare sources (MHS, 834, MP, HRP)
Built an ODS (Operational Data Store) as a refined and integrated data layer
Implemented Lakehouse architecture to support both analytics and reporting
Created STTM (Source to Target Mapping) documents for traceability
Authored detailed metamodel documentation for data cataloging and governance
Enabled scalable data processing pipelines to handle high-volume datasets

projects.title: Restaurant Web Application
projects.description: Built a full-stack restaurant-focused web application to enhance and streamline the dining experience. Implemented user authentication using OAuth and JWT. Users can sign up, log in, search for restaurants based on dietary preferences, add items to cart, place orders, rate menu items, and earn credits. The application is backed by Node.js, Express, and a hybrid MySQL + MongoDB data model, with React and TypeScript powering the frontend. Deployed on AWS EC2 with asset storage handled via AWS S3.
features: User authentication using OAuth and JWT (login, signup, logout)
Restaurant search based on dietary preferences
Shopping cart functionality and order placement
Menu item rating and credit reward system
Hybrid database design using MySQL and MongoDB
Deployed on AWS EC2 with S3 for asset storage
Responsive and interactive UI using React and TypeScript

projects.title: Hospital Management Dashboard
projects.description: Developed a full-featured Hospital Management Dashboard using React, TypeScript, and Material UI, following the MVC (Model-View-Controller) architecture. The application enables hospital administrators to manage core operations such as patient records, staff scheduling, appointments, and analytics. The system begins with an admin login, which upon successful authentication, redirects the user to the home page. The home page serves as a central hub linking to multiple sections: Patients, Staff, Appointments, and Analytics. Integrated Recharts to build a dedicated Analytics page that provides interactive visualizations of hospital data such as daily appointments, staff activity, and patient demographics. Worked on RESTful API integration using tools like Postman for testing and Swagger for API documentation. Designed a modular component structure, prioritized responsiveness and implemented state management to handle dynamic data rendering.
features: Secure Admin Login with role-based access
Home dashboard with navigation to key modules: Patients, Staff, Appointments, Analytics
Analytics visualizations built using Recharts
Clean, responsive UI using Material UI Grid & Components
MVC-based architecture for maintainability and code separation
API integration with Postman and Swagger for testing and documentation

projects.title: Corporate Website Development
projects.description: Designed and developed a fully responsive corporate website for Hathlogic using React.js. Integrated RESTful APIs with Axios for dynamic data handling and implemented Google Maps API to display location-based services. Employed Bootstrap and custom CSS media queries to ensure seamless performance across all devices. Integrated Redux for internationalization, enabling the website to support three languages. The website reflects a modern UI and user-centric design, aligning with the brandâ€™s corporate identity.
features: Responsive layout compatible across all screen sizes and devices
API integration using Axios for real-time content rendering
Google Maps integration for dynamic location display
Multilingual support using Redux for internationalization (3 languages)
Modern UI with clean, brand-aligned design
